pageContext.claim: “So surprised to see Conservative thinkers like James Woods banned from Twitter, and Paul Watson banned from Facebook!”
pageContext.analysis: Twitter technically did not ban Woods. He could regain access if he removes a tweet that broke the platform's rules. Woods, a pro-Trump actor, tweeted "hang them all" after special counsel Robert Mueller's report was released.  Watson, a staff member of the conspiracy theory website InfoWars, was banned from Facebook for posting content that broke the platform's rules.
